thread.title: North East Vision, August 2017: Is it time to be part of the crowd?

title: North East Vision, August 2017: Is it time to be part of the crowd?
text:

Crowdfunding as a means of raising capital finance has witnessed a rapid rise in popularity in the past five years 
But is this ‘democratisation of finance’ too good to be true – and is it here to stay? 
Your local bank, a venture capital house or some friends or family with deep pockets were, for a long-time, the default options for a company seeking to raise growth and development capital. 
Business writer MARK LANE finds out why crowdfunding is significantly widening the opportunity for North East entrepreneurs to access capital 
More than year has passed since the historic Brexit vote, giving North East exporters time to get to grips with its implications. MARK LANE meets some of them and canvasses their opinions. 
And finally it would be an exaggeration to suggest that the days of 9-5 being the predominant working pattern are a thing of the past – you only need head onto the roads in the early morning rush hour to appreciate that. 
But as we discover flexible working for North East businesses needs to be embraced rather than viewed as a legislative burden to be managed.
